25 #include "inc/hw_memmap.h"
26 //*****************************************************************************
27 //
28 //! \brief Used in the Comp_B_init() function as the param parameter.
29 //
30 //*****************************************************************************
31 typedef struct Comp_B_initParam {
32  //! Selects the input to the positive terminal.
33  //! \n Valid values are:
34  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT0 [Default]
35  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT1
36  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT2
37  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT3
38  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT4
39  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT5
40  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT6
41  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT7
42  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT8
43  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT9
44  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT10
45  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT11
46  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT12
47  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT13
48  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT14
49  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT15
50  //! - \b COMP_B_VREF
51  uint8_t positiveTerminalInput;
52  //! Selects the input to the negative terminal.
53  //! \n Valid values are:
54  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT0 [Default]
55  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT1
56  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT2
57  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT3
58  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT4
59  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT5
60  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT6
61  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT7
62  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT8
63  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT9
64  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT10
65  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT11
66  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT12
67  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT13
68  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT14
69  //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT15
70  //! - \b COMP_B_VREF
71  uint8_t negativeTerminalInput;
72  //! Selects the power mode at which the Comp_B module will operate at.
73  //! \n Valid values are:
74  //! - \b COMP_B_POWERMODE_HIGHSPEED [Default]
75  //! - \b COMP_B_POWERMODE_NORMALMODE
76  //! - \b COMP_B_POWERMODE_ULTRALOWPOWER
77  uint16_t powerModeSelect;
78  //! Controls the output filter delay state, which is either off or enabled
79  //! with a specified delay level. This parameter is device specific and
80  //! delay levels should be found in the device's datasheet.
81  //! \n Valid values are:
82  //! - \b COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_OFF [Default]
83  //! - \b COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL1
84  //! - \b COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL2
85  //! - \b COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL3
86  //! - \b COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL4
87  uint8_t outputFilterEnableAndDelayLevel;
88  //! Controls if the output will be inverted or not
89  //! \n Valid values are:
90  //! - \b COMP_B_NORMALOUTPUTPOLARITY [Default]
91  //! - \b COMP_B_INVERTEDOUTPUTPOLARITY
92  uint16_t invertedOutputPolarity;
93 } Comp_B_initParam;
94 
95 //*****************************************************************************
96 //
97 //! \brief Used in the Comp_B_configureReferenceVoltage() function as the param
98 //! parameter.
99 //
100 //*****************************************************************************
101 typedef struct Comp_B_configureReferenceVoltageParam {
102  //! Decides the source and max amount of Voltage that can be used as a
103  //! reference.
104  //! \n Valid values are:
105  //! - \b COMP_B_VREFBASE_VCC
106  //! - \b COMP_B_VREFBASE1_5V
107  //! - \b COMP_B_VREFBASE2_0V
108  //! - \b COMP_B_VREFBASE2_5V
109  uint16_t supplyVoltageReferenceBase;
110  //! Is the numerator of the equation to generate the reference voltage for
111  //! the lower limit reference voltage.
112  uint16_t lowerLimitSupplyVoltageFractionOf32;
113  //! Is the numerator of the equation to generate the reference voltage for
114  //! the upper limit reference voltage.
115  uint16_t upperLimitSupplyVoltageFractionOf32;
116  //! is the reference accuracy setting of the Comp_B. Clocked is for low
117  //! power/low accuracy.
118  //! \n Valid values are:
119  //! - \b COMP_B_ACCURACY_STATIC
120  //! - \b COMP_B_ACCURACY_CLOCKED
121  uint16_t referenceAccuracy;
122 } Comp_B_configureReferenceVoltageParam;
123 
124 
125 //*****************************************************************************
126 //
127 // The following are values that can be passed to the powerModeSelect parameter
128 // for functions: Comp_B_init(); the param parameter for functions:
129 // Comp_B_init().
130 //
131 //*****************************************************************************
132 #define COMP_B_POWERMODE_HIGHSPEED (CBPWRMD_0)
133 #define COMP_B_POWERMODE_NORMALMODE (CBPWRMD_1)
134 #define COMP_B_POWERMODE_ULTRALOWPOWER (CBPWRMD_2)
135 
136 //*****************************************************************************
137 //
138 // The following are values that can be passed to the positiveTerminalInput
139 // parameter for functions: Comp_B_init(); the inputPort parameter for
140 // functions: Comp_B_disableInputBuffer(), and Comp_B_enableInputBuffer(); the
141 // param parameter for functions: Comp_B_init(), and Comp_B_init(); the
142 // negativeTerminalInput parameter for functions: Comp_B_init().
143 //
144 //*****************************************************************************
145 #define COMP_B_INPUT0 (CBIPSEL_0)
146 #define COMP_B_INPUT1 (CBIPSEL_1)
147 #define COMP_B_INPUT2 (CBIPSEL_2)
148 #define COMP_B_INPUT3 (CBIPSEL_3)
149 #define COMP_B_INPUT4 (CBIPSEL_4)
150 #define COMP_B_INPUT5 (CBIPSEL_5)
151 #define COMP_B_INPUT6 (CBIPSEL_6)
152 #define COMP_B_INPUT7 (CBIPSEL_7)
153 #define COMP_B_INPUT8 (CBIPSEL_8)
154 #define COMP_B_INPUT9 (CBIPSEL_9)
155 #define COMP_B_INPUT10 (CBIPSEL_10)
156 #define COMP_B_INPUT11 (CBIPSEL_11)
157 #define COMP_B_INPUT12 (CBIPSEL_12)
158 #define COMP_B_INPUT13 (CBIPSEL_13)
159 #define COMP_B_INPUT14 (CBIPSEL_14)
160 #define COMP_B_INPUT15 (CBIPSEL_15)
161 #define COMP_B_VREF (0x10)
162 
163 //*****************************************************************************
164 //
165 // The following are values that can be passed to the
166 // outputFilterEnableAndDelayLevel parameter for functions: Comp_B_init(); the
167 // param parameter for functions: Comp_B_init().
168 //
169 //*****************************************************************************
170 #define COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_OFF 0x00
171 #define COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL1 (CBF + CBFDLY_0)
172 #define COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL2 (CBF + CBFDLY_1)
173 #define COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL3 (CBF + CBFDLY_2)
174 #define COMP_B_FILTEROUTPUT_DLYLVL4 (CBF + CBFDLY_3)
175 
176 //*****************************************************************************
177 //
178 // The following are values that can be passed to the invertedOutputPolarity
179 // parameter for functions: Comp_B_init(); the param parameter for functions:
180 // Comp_B_init().
181 //
182 //*****************************************************************************
183 #define COMP_B_NORMALOUTPUTPOLARITY (!(CBOUTPOL))
184 #define COMP_B_INVERTEDOUTPUTPOLARITY (CBOUTPOL)
185 
186 //*****************************************************************************
187 //
188 // The following are values that can be passed to the param parameter for
189 // functions: Comp_B_configureReferenceVoltage().
190 //
191 //*****************************************************************************
192 #define COMP_B_ACCURACY_STATIC (!CBREFACC)
193 #define COMP_B_ACCURACY_CLOCKED (CBREFACC)
194 
195 //*****************************************************************************
196 //
197 // The following are values that can be passed to the param parameter for
198 // functions: Comp_B_configureReferenceVoltage().
199 //
200 //*****************************************************************************
201 #define COMP_B_VREFBASE_VCC (CBREFL_0)
202 #define COMP_B_VREFBASE1_5V (CBREFL_1)
203 #define COMP_B_VREFBASE2_0V (CBREFL_2)
204 #define COMP_B_VREFBASE2_5V (CBREFL_3)
205 
206 //*****************************************************************************
207 //
208 // The following are values that can be passed to the interruptMask parameter
209 // for functions: Comp_B_enableInterrupt(), and Comp_B_disableInterrupt().
210 //
211 //*****************************************************************************
212 #define COMP_B_OUTPUT_INT CBIE
213 #define COMP_B_OUTPUTINVERTED_INT CBIIE
214 
215 //*****************************************************************************
216 //
217 // The following are values that can be passed to the interruptFlagMask
218 // parameter for functions: Comp_B_clearInterrupt(), and
219 // Comp_B_getInterruptStatus() as well as returned by the
220 // Comp_B_getInterruptStatus() function.
221 //
222 //*****************************************************************************
223 #define COMP_B_OUTPUT_FLAG CBIFG
224 #define COMP_B_OUTPUTINVERTED_FLAG CBIIFG
225 
226 //*****************************************************************************
227 //
228 // The following are values that can be passed to the edgeDirection parameter
229 // for functions: Comp_B_setInterruptEdgeDirection().
230 //
231 //*****************************************************************************
232 #define COMP_B_FALLINGEDGE (!(CBIES))
233 #define COMP_B_RISINGEDGE (CBIES)
234 
235 //*****************************************************************************
236 //
237 // The following are values that can be passed toThe following are values that
238 // can be returned by the Comp_B_outputValue() function.
239 //
240 //*****************************************************************************
241 #define COMP_B_LOW (0x0)
242 #define COMP_B_HIGH (CBOUT)
243 
244 //*****************************************************************************
245 //
246 // Prototypes for the APIs.
247 //
248 //*****************************************************************************
249 
250 //*****************************************************************************
251 //
252 //! \brief Initializes the Comp_B Module.
253 //!
254 //! Upon successful initialization of the Comp_B module, this function will
255 //! have reset all necessary register bits and set the given options in the
256 //! registers. To actually use the Comp_B module, the Comp_B_enable() function
257 //! must be explicitly called before use. If a Reference Voltage is set to a
258 //! terminal, the Voltage should be set using the Comp_B_setReferenceVoltage()
259 //! function.
260 //!
261 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
262 //! \param param is the pointer to struct for initialization.
263 //!
264 //! \return STATUS_SUCCESS or STATUS_FAILURE of the initialization process.
265 //
266 //*****************************************************************************
267 extern bool Comp_B_init(uint16_t baseAddress,
268  Comp_B_initParam *param);
269 
270 //*****************************************************************************
271 //
272 //! \brief Generates a Reference Voltage to the terminal selected during
273 //! initialization.
274 //!
275 //! Use this function to generate a voltage to serve as a reference to the
276 //! terminal selected at initialization. The voltage is determined by the
277 //! equation: Vbase * (Numerator / 32). If the upper and lower limit voltage
278 //! numerators are equal, then a static reference is defined, whereas they are
279 //! different then a hysteresis effect is generated.
280 //!
281 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
282 //! \param param is the pointer to struct for reference voltage configuration.
283 //!
284 //! \return None
285 //
286 //*****************************************************************************
287 extern void Comp_B_configureReferenceVoltage(uint16_t baseAddress,
288  Comp_B_configureReferenceVoltageParam *param);
289 
290 //*****************************************************************************
291 //
292 //! \brief Enables selected Comp_B interrupt sources.
293 //!
294 //! Enables the indicated Comp_B interrupt sources. Only the sources that are
295 //! enabled can be reflected to the processor interrupt; disabled sources have
296 //! no effect on the processor. Does not clear interrupt flags.
297 //!
298 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
299 //! \param interruptMask is the bit mask of the interrupt sources to be
300 //! enabled.
301 //! Mask value is the logical OR of any of the following:
302 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUT_INT - Output interrupt
303 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUTINVERTED_INT - Output interrupt inverted polarity
304 //! \n Modified bits of \b CBINT register.
305 //!
306 //! \return None
307 //
308 //*****************************************************************************
309 extern void Comp_B_enableInterrupt(uint16_t baseAddress,
310  uint16_t interruptMask);
311 
312 //*****************************************************************************
313 //
314 //! \brief Disables selected Comp_B interrupt sources.
315 //!
316 //! Disables the indicated Comp_B interrupt sources. Only the sources that are
317 //! enabled can be reflected to the processor interrupt; disabled sources have
318 //! no effect on the processor.
319 //!
320 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
321 //! \param interruptMask is the bit mask of the interrupt sources to be
322 //! disabled.
323 //! Mask value is the logical OR of any of the following:
324 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUT_INT - Output interrupt
325 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUTINVERTED_INT - Output interrupt inverted polarity
326 //! \n Modified bits of \b CBINT register.
327 //!
328 //! \return None
329 //
330 //*****************************************************************************
331 extern void Comp_B_disableInterrupt(uint16_t baseAddress,
332  uint16_t interruptMask);
333 
334 //*****************************************************************************
335 //
336 //! \brief Clears Comp_B interrupt flags.
337 //!
338 //! The Comp_B interrupt source is cleared, so that it no longer asserts. The
339 //! highest interrupt flag is automatically cleared when an interrupt vector
340 //! generator is used.
341 //!
342 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
343 //! \param interruptFlagMask is a bit mask of the interrupt sources to be
344 //! cleared.
345 //! Mask value is the logical OR of any of the following:
346 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUT_FLAG - Output interrupt
347 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUTINVERTED_FLAG - Output interrupt inverted polarity
348 //! \n Modified bits of \b CBINT register.
349 //!
350 //! \return None
351 //
352 //*****************************************************************************
353 extern void Comp_B_clearInterrupt(uint16_t baseAddress,
354  uint16_t interruptFlagMask);
355 
356 //*****************************************************************************
357 //
358 //! \brief Gets the current Comp_B interrupt status.
359 //!
360 //! This returns the interrupt status for the Comp_B module based on which flag
361 //! is passed.
362 //!
363 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
364 //! \param interruptFlagMask is the masked interrupt flag status to be
365 //! returned.
366 //! Mask value is the logical OR of any of the following:
367 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUT_FLAG - Output interrupt
368 //! - \b COMP_B_OUTPUTINVERTED_FLAG - Output interrupt inverted polarity
369 //!
370 //! \return Logical OR of any of the following:
371 //! - \b Comp_B_OUTPUT_FLAG Output interrupt
372 //! - \b Comp_B_OUTPUTINVERTED_FLAG Output interrupt inverted polarity
373 //! \n indicating the status of the masked interrupts
374 //
375 //*****************************************************************************
376 extern uint8_t Comp_B_getInterruptStatus(uint16_t baseAddress,
377  uint16_t interruptFlagMask);
378 
379 //*****************************************************************************
380 //
381 //! \brief Explicitly sets the edge direction that would trigger an interrupt.
382 //!
383 //! This function will set which direction the output will have to go, whether
384 //! rising or falling, to generate an interrupt based on a non-inverted
385 //! interrupt.
386 //!
387 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
388 //! \param edgeDirection determines which direction the edge would have to go
389 //! to generate an interrupt based on the non-inverted interrupt flag.
390 //! Valid values are:
391 //! - \b COMP_B_FALLINGEDGE [Default] - sets the bit to generate an
392 //! interrupt when the output of the Comp_B falls from HIGH to LOW if
393 //! the normal interrupt bit is set(and LOW to HIGH if the inverted
394 //! interrupt enable bit is set).
395 //! - \b COMP_B_RISINGEDGE - sets the bit to generate an interrupt when
396 //! the output of the Comp_B rises from LOW to HIGH if the normal
397 //! interrupt bit is set(and HIGH to LOW if the inverted interrupt
398 //! enable bit is set).
399 //! \n Modified bits are \b CBIES of \b CBCTL1 register.
400 //!
401 //! \return None
402 //
403 //*****************************************************************************
404 extern void Comp_B_setInterruptEdgeDirection(uint16_t baseAddress,
405  uint16_t edgeDirection);
406 
407 //*****************************************************************************
408 //
409 //! \brief Toggles the edge direction that would trigger an interrupt.
410 //!
411 //! This function will toggle which direction the output will have to go,
412 //! whether rising or falling, to generate an interrupt based on a non-inverted
413 //! interrupt. If the direction was rising, it is now falling, if it was
414 //! falling, it is now rising.
415 //!
416 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
417 //!
418 //! \return None
419 //
420 //*****************************************************************************
421 extern void Comp_B_toggleInterruptEdgeDirection(uint16_t baseAddress);
422 
423 //*****************************************************************************
424 //
425 //! \brief Turns on the Comp_B module.
426 //!
427 //! This function sets the bit that enables the operation of the Comp_B module.
428 //!
429 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
430 //!
431 //! \return None
432 //
433 //*****************************************************************************
434 extern void Comp_B_enable(uint16_t baseAddress);
435 
436 //*****************************************************************************
437 //
438 //! \brief Turns off the Comp_B module.
439 //!
440 //! This function clears the CBON bit disabling the operation of the Comp_B
441 //! module, saving from excess power consumption.
442 //!
443 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
444 //!
445 //! \return None
446 //
447 //*****************************************************************************
448 extern void Comp_B_disable(uint16_t baseAddress);
449 
450 //*****************************************************************************
451 //
452 //! \brief Shorts the two input pins chosen during initialization.
453 //!
454 //! This function sets the bit that shorts the devices attached to the input
455 //! pins chosen from the initialization of the Comp_B.
456 //!
457 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
458 //!
459 //! \return None
460 //
461 //*****************************************************************************
462 extern void Comp_B_shortInputs(uint16_t baseAddress);
463 
464 //*****************************************************************************
465 //
466 //! \brief Disables the short of the two input pins chosen during
467 //! initialization.
468 //!
469 //! This function clears the bit that shorts the devices attached to the input
470 //! pins chosen from the initialization of the Comp_B.
471 //!
472 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
473 //!
474 //! \return None
475 //
476 //*****************************************************************************
477 extern void Comp_B_unshortInputs(uint16_t baseAddress);
478 
479 //*****************************************************************************
480 //
481 //! \brief Disables the input buffer of the selected input port to effectively
482 //! allow for analog signals.
483 //!
484 //! This function sets the bit to disable the buffer for the specified input
485 //! port to allow for analog signals from any of the Comp_B input pins. This
486 //! bit is automatically set when the input is initialized to be used with the
487 //! Comp_B module. This function should be used whenever an analog input is
488 //! connected to one of these pins to prevent parasitic voltage from causing
489 //! unexpected results.
490 //!
491 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
492 //! \param inputPort is the port in which the input buffer will be disabled.
493 //! Valid values are:
494 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT0 [Default]
495 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT1
496 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT2
497 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT3
498 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT4
499 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT5
500 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT6
501 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT7
502 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT8
503 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT9
504 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT10
505 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT11
506 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT12
507 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT13
508 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT14
509 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT15
510 //! - \b COMP_B_VREF
511 //! \n Modified bits are \b CBPDx of \b CBCTL3 register.
512 //!
513 //! \return None
514 //
515 //*****************************************************************************
516 extern void Comp_B_disableInputBuffer(uint16_t baseAddress,
517  uint8_t inputPort);
518 
519 //*****************************************************************************
520 //
521 //! \brief Enables the input buffer of the selected input port to allow for
522 //! digital signals.
523 //!
524 //! This function clears the bit to enable the buffer for the specified input
525 //! port to allow for digital signals from any of the Comp_B input pins. This
526 //! should not be reset if there is an analog signal connected to the specified
527 //! input pin to prevent from unexpected results.
528 //!
529 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
530 //! \param inputPort is the port in which the input buffer will be enabled.
531 //! Valid values are:
532 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT0 [Default]
533 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT1
534 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT2
535 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT3
536 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT4
537 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT5
538 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT6
539 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT7
540 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT8
541 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT9
542 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT10
543 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT11
544 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT12
545 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT13
546 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT14
547 //! - \b COMP_B_INPUT15
548 //! - \b COMP_B_VREF
549 //! \n Modified bits are \b CBPDx of \b CBCTL3 register.
550 //!
551 //! \return None
552 //
553 //*****************************************************************************
554 extern void Comp_B_enableInputBuffer(uint16_t baseAddress,
555  uint8_t inputPort);
556 
557 //*****************************************************************************
558 //
559 //! \brief Toggles the bit that swaps which terminals the inputs go to, while
560 //! also inverting the output of the Comp_B.
561 //!
562 //! This function toggles the bit that controls which input goes to which
563 //! terminal. After initialization, this bit is set to 0, after toggling it
564 //! once the inputs are routed to the opposite terminal and the output is
565 //! inverted.
566 //!
567 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
568 //!
569 //! \return None
570 //
571 //*****************************************************************************
572 extern void Comp_B_swapIO(uint16_t baseAddress);
573 
574 //*****************************************************************************
575 //
576 //! \brief Returns the output value of the Comp_B module.
577 //!
578 //! Returns the output value of the Comp_B module.
579 //!
580 //! \param baseAddress is the base address of the COMP_B module.
581 //!
582 //! \return One of the following:
583 //! - \b Comp_B_LOW
584 //! - \b Comp_B_HIGH
585 //! \n indicating the output value of the Comp_B module
586 //
587 //*****************************************************************************
588 extern uint16_t Comp_B_outputValue(uint16_t baseAddress);
589

596 }
